properties.name: Florida Caverns State Park
properties.description: The only state park in Florida offering public cave tours, featuring stunning limestone formations and hiking trails.

properties.name: Three Rivers State Park
properties.description: Located at the confluence of the Chattahoochee, Flint, and Apalachicola Rivers, offering camping, fishing, and boating opportunities.

properties.name: Blue Springs Recreational Area
properties.description: A popular swimming and diving spot known for its clear, spring-fed waters and scenic surroundings.

properties.name: Jackson County Courthouse
properties.description: Historic courthouse located in Marianna, serving as the center of county government.

properties.name: Chipola College
properties.description: A public college in Marianna offering a range of academic programs and cultural events.

properties.name: Marianna Civil War Battlefield
properties.description: Site of the Battle of Marianna during the Civil War, featuring historical markers and interpretive signage.

properties.name: Lake Seminole
properties.description: A large reservoir at the confluence of the Chattahoochee and Flint Rivers, popular for fishing and boating.

properties.name: Compass Lake
properties.description: A natural freshwater lake known for its recreational opportunities, including swimming and kayaking.

properties.name: Ocheesee Pond
properties.description: A cypress-lined pond offering excellent fishing and bird-watching opportunities.

properties.name: Riverside Cemetery
properties.description: Historic cemetery in Marianna, final resting place of notable local figures including Civil War soldiers.

properties.name: Spring Creek Park
properties.description: Shaded city park in Marianna offering walking trails, a splash pad, and a boardwalk over Spring Creek.

properties.name: The Russ House
properties.description: A historic Victorian mansion now serving as a visitor center and the Jackson County Chamber of Commerce.

properties.name: Bellamy Bridge Heritage Trail
properties.description: A short hiking trail leading to the ruins of Florida's oldest known steel-frame bridge, tied to local ghost lore.

properties.name: Hinson Conservation and Recreation Area
properties.description: A nature preserve in Marianna offering trails, picnic areas, and access to the Chipola River, ideal for hiking and kayaking.
